metadata.title: CVE-2017-11104 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Knot DNS before 2.4.5 and 2.5.x before 2.5.2 contains a flaw within theTSIG protocol implementation that would allow an attacker with a valid keyname and algorithm to bypass TSIG authentication if no additional ACLrestrictions are set, because of an improper TSIG validity period check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11104` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot - 2.6.5-3
knot-dnssecutils - 2.6.5-3
knot-dnsutils - 2.6.5-3
knot-host - 2.6.5-3
knot-module-dnstap - 2.6.5-3
knot-module-geoip - 2.6.5-3
libdnssec9 - 2.6.5-3
libknot13 - 2.6.5-3
libzscanner4 - 2.6.5-3
python3-libknot - 2.6.5-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-3').
